titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: A most beautiful day, but curiously exhausting. The lilacs & laburnums are in their glory, & the rhododendrons are breaking into flower.

p.hi: I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Cathedral at 8 a.m. At Mattins Budworth preached. He is not a great preacher, but his candid simple manner redeemed his discourse from fatuity.

body.p: Three King's Scholars – Gowan–Taylor, Parr, and A. F. R. Brown – came to lunch.

I preached at Evensong in St Cuthbert's Church. There was an attentive congregation largely composed of young men. The vicar, Tollinton, seems to be earnest. My text was Isaiah 57. 20, 21, & my subject the Unrest of the Wicked.
